meta.name: viewport
meta.title: AMPEL360 BWB-Q100 Quantum Sensor Layout Map

g.text: AMPEL360 BWB-Q100 Quantum Sensor Layout Map
Document: 06-90-10-01-01 | 2,847 Quantum Sensors | Coverage: 891.2 m² | Scale: 1:100

div.h3: AMPEL360 BWB-Q100 Quantum Sensor Network Analysis
div.p: This interactive visualization displays the comprehensive quantum sensor layout for the GAIA-QAO BWB (Blended Wing Body) aircraft. The system employs 2,847 quantum sensors across 891.2 m² of coverage area, achieving 97.3% optimization efficiency with zero blind spots.
Wing root attachments and main structural joints requiring maximum monitoring precision
Technology: Diamond NV-Centers for structural health monitoring
Critical load-bearing components with dynamic stress patterns
Technology: Quantum dots for environmental and stress monitoring
Main structural elements requiring continuous health monitoring
Technology: Mixed quantum sensor array for comprehensive coverage
Secondary structures with standard monitoring requirements
Technology: Photonic sensors for optical monitoring applications
Non-critical areas with basic monitoring coverage
Technology: Atom interferometry for gravity and rotation sensing
Response Time: <1 μs anywhere on aircraft
